intro: Nuttallia malviflora, commonly known as the yellow mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous small seeds. Nuttallia malviflora is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
